result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

8:32 AM Defendant Brian D. Burkheimer in court, in custody from the Rock County Jail.  Attorney Kelly James Mattingly in court for Brian D. Burkheimer.  Attorney Gerald Anthony Urbik in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleads guilty to Count 3; Court finds defendant guilty.  Counts 1, 2 and 4 are dismissed and read in. Court orders presentence investigation. Bond revoked.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 12, 2023 at 02:15 pm.
Bail/bond hearing on September 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Gerald Anthony Urbik appeared appearing by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Cash bond set of $2,000.00  with conditions. No driving at all. Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody. Preliminary hearing requested and set for January 14, 2022 at 1:45 pm.
